intro: Bulbostylis scleropus, commonly known as the hard-shelled bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, pale green flowers. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
